evidence.text:
Person A: I hear there was an unfortunate disturbance in Doctor Dillamond's class today. That must have been distressful for you.
Person B: Someone wrote those horrendible words, on purpose, for him to see-- I just wish--
Person B: That there was something I could do! Because no one should be--
Person A: No one should be what?
Person B: Scorned, or laughed at, or looked down upon, or told to stop jabbering AND KEEP QUIET!

Person A: This is your chance. To make good. Of course, you'll have to prove yourself first.
Person A: Don't be so pessi-mystical. You'll find a way. I have faith in you.
Person A: Don't be discouraged if you can't decipherate it, Dearie, I myself can only read a word or two, and that took years and years of--
Person B: Chistery! Are you all right?
Person A: It's just the transition, Dearie...
Person B: I knew it! I knew she had the power, I told you!

Person B: You've known all along... from the moment you met me.
Person A: You w ill benefit, too, Dearie. You must trust me--

Person B: You can't read this book at all, can you?
Person B: That's why you need spies. And cages... and an enemy. You have no real power.
